page.title: 01The 'Foothills' of Snowdonia
page.content: The major part of the areal survey lies above 900' above sea level. An area of heather, coarse wet grassland with devastatingly beautiful views of Anglesey and on a clear day, Ireland. Once quarrying was the main occupation of the villages of Rhiwlas (Penrhyn Quarry) and Deiniolen (Llanberis Quarry). Nowadays most workers in the village work in Caernarfon, Bangor. Both villages are socially unconnected Rhiwlas being now a dormitory village for Bangor - with its light industry, shops and University. Deiniolen is far more closely allied to Caernarfon - light industry, County Council HQ, etc. The hinterland for both villages is the Snowdonia 'massif' - some small industry at Deiniolen reflect the 'leisure' pursuits of the area - Clogwyn industries make hardware for climbers. About 50% of each village
